title: Create Inbox Monitoring Automation
deliverables: Automated monitoring script that checks inbox every 15 minutes for new items
Alert system that notifies agents within 5 minutes of blocks_sprint item arrival
Configuration file for customizable monitoring intervals and alert thresholds
Integration with session startup to trigger inbox-query.py automatically
Dashboard displaying inbox status, alert history, and SLA compliance metrics
Documentation for setup, configuration, and troubleshooting procedures
Test suite validating alert delivery within 5 minutes for priority items
Performance report showing response time improvements and SLA violation reduction
acceptance_criteria: Automated monitoring checks inbox every ≤5 minutes for new items
System detects and flags blocks_sprint urgency items within 30 seconds of arrival
Alert notifications are sent within 60 seconds of detecting high-priority items
Monitoring integrates with session startup and runs inbox-query.py automatically
Configuration allows customizable alert thresholds for ≥3 urgency levels
System logs all monitoring events with timestamps for audit trail
Monitoring service achieves ≥99% uptime over 24-hour test period
Alert system supports ≥2 notification channels (e.g., console, file)
Documentation includes setup instructions and configuration examples
System reduces average response time to blocks_sprint items by ≥50%

context.background: Agents currently check inbox manually at session startup using inbox-query.py. There's no automated notification when high-priority items arrive. This could cause SLA violations for blocks_sprint urgency items.
context.rationale: Reduce response time and improve SLA compliance. Enable proactive inbox monitoring rather than reactive checking. Support the 4-hour acknowledgment SLA for blocks_sprint items.
